alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Crockett; Decatur; Dyer; Gibson; Hardin; Haywood; Henderson; Henry; Lauderdale; Madison; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Weakley, Henderson, northeastern Lauderdale, northeastern Hardin, northern Haywood, northern Madison, Crockett, eastern Dyer, Gibson, southern Benton, Carroll, southwestern Henry and Decatur Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 541 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Belle Eagle to near Bargerton to near Decaturville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Dyersburg, Humboldt, Ripley, Milan, Lexington, McKenzie, Trenton, Huntingdon, Camden, Natchez Trace State Forest, Natchez Trace State Park, Fairview, Newbern, Alamo, Bells, Parsons, Dyer, Halls and Greenfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Memphis.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Carroll; Crockett; Decatur; Dyer; Gibson; Hardin; Haywood; Henderson; Henry; Lauderdale; Madison; Weakley
